net.minecraft.entity.player

クラス PlayerInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerInventory
  • すべての実装されたインタフェース:
    IClearable, IInventory, INameable

    public class PlayerInventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IInventory, INameable

        public int clearMatchingItems(java.util.function.Predicate<ItemStack> p_195408_1_,
                              int count)

      • storeItemStack

        public int storeItemStack(ItemStack itemStackIn)
        Stores a stack in the player's inventory. It first tries to place it in the selected slot in the player's hotbar, then the offhand slot, then any available/empty slot in the player's inventory.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Decrement the number of animations remaining. Only called on client side. This is used to handle the animation of receiving a block.

      • addItemStackToInventory

        public boolean addItemStackToInventory(ItemStack itemStackIn)
        Adds the stack to the first empty slot in the player's inventory. Returns false if it's not possible to place the entire stack in the inventory.

      • add

        public boolean add(int slotIn,
                   ItemStack stack)
        Adds the stack to the specified slot in the player's inventory. Returns false if it's not possible to place the entire stack in the inventory.

      • placeItemBackInInventory

        public void placeItemBackInInventory(World worldIn,
                                     ItemStack stack)

      • decrStackSize

        public ItemStack decrStackSize(int index,
                               int count)
        Removes up to a specified number of items from an inventory slot and returns them in a new stack.

      • setInventorySlotContents

        public void setInventorySlotContents(int index,
                                     ItemStack stack)
        Sets the given item stack to the specified slot in the inventory (can be crafting or armor sections).
        定義:
        setInventorySlotContents インタフェース内 IInventory

      • getDestroySpeed

        public float getDestroySpeed(BlockState state)

      • write

        public ListNBT write(ListNBT nbtTagListIn)
        Writes the inventory out as a list of compound tags. This is where the slot indices are used (+100 for armor, +80 for crafting).

      • read

        public void read(ListNBT nbtTagListIn)
        Reads from the given tag list and fills the slots in the inventory with the correct items.

      • getSizeInventory

        Drop all armor and main inventory items.

      • markDirty

        public void markDirty()
        For tile entities, ensures the chunk containing the tile entity is saved to disk later - the game won't think it hasn't changed and skip it.
        定義:
        markDirty インタフェース内 IInventory
